article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 66, Cleveland St. 55
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Majak Kou scored 18 points and J.R. Blount, who was 10-for-12 from the free throw line, had 17 as Loyola of Chicago beat Cleveland State 66-55 Thursday night. Tracy Robinson added 10 points for the Ramblers (10-5, 2-1 Horizon League), who shot 13-for-23 in the first half to build a 34-23 lead heading into halftime. Joe Davis, who scored half of his 18 points from 3-point range, led the scoring for Cleveland State (6-10, 0-3). Carlos English had 12 while Kevin Francis chipped in 10 and grabbed seven rebounds for the Vikings before fouling out with 1:12 to go in the game. Cleveland State scored 29 points off 21 Loyola turnovers, compared to just eight points off turnovers for the Ramblers, and hit five more baskets from the field than Loyola in an even-scoring second half. But the Ramblers had twice as many chances from the foul line after the break and scored 17 free throws compared to just five for the Vikings.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.
